p: C. macowanii leaves have been used traditionally to cleanse the blood, treat coughs, kidney, and bladder diseases in humans and animals, and also t treat coughs and diarrhea [ 20]. The results obtained in this study indicate the inhibition of B. subtilis, M. smegmatis, and P. vulgaris at 0.500 mg/mL, and S. aureus, E. coli, and K. pneumonia were inhibited at 0.250 mg/mL and S. epidermidis and P. aeruginosa at 1.00 mg/mL and 0.125 mg/mL, and respectively.
